data.title: Around the End of the World (1930)
data.meta_description: An 18-minute silent documentary on the making of the 1931 Abel Gance directed film, "La Fin Du Monde".
data.text:
Who knew that avant-garde filmmaker Eugene Deslaw shot behind-the-scenes footage of Gance's underrated gem La Fin du Monde and turned it into a surrealist sci-fi experience

As a "making of" piece this tells you very little of how the actual film was made, but as a mood piece and a late impressionistic film it's definitely something. It blends documentary and re-enactment in a way that you can never really tell what's the crew and what's the actors in a scene, and it's fitting since the film itself is a huge sci-fi spectacle that in itself was a technical marvel. I like how French filmmakers of this period always flirted with sci-fi elements at some point, so this is sort of a relic of its time in its way as well

For Gance nerds this is a treat, and I'm served
